candidates.title: Adapt tests to work for wasm32-wasi and add wasm32-wasi to CI.
candidates.body:
This is based on PR #1568. See the commit message of the first commit for details. Basically I squashed all the commits together from @JanKaul's PR, removed the changes to `build.rs`, and the GitHub Actions configuration, and rebased onto `main`.

For the CI integration, [ring-toolchain](https://github.com/briansmith/ring-toolchain) was updated to include wasmtime for x86-64 Linux. That is used to install wasmtime in CI.

candidates.title: Bump dependency requirements to what's been tested.
candidates.body: Older versions may work but we've not been testing those old versions.

candidates.title: Move benchmarks to a new `ring-bench` crate.
candidates.body: Move the Criterion.rs dependency out of *ring* into a new `ring-benches` crate. This speeds up many build scenerios by eliminating a bunch of dependencies from *ring*'s dependency tree for `cargo test`.
This is 0.17.1 with one addition to Cargo.toml to add a header file that wasn't listed.

candidates.title: Remove doc/link-to-readme.md.
candidates.body: The intended effect was to redirect people reading about *ring* on crates.io to the GitHub-hosted README.md. However, the unintended effect was that docs.rs is broken for the 0.17.0 release.

candidates.title: Enable FE25519_ADX Curve25519 implementation on x86-64.
candidates.body: When merging BoringSSL 43f88915f97d1f7df489b4b706afdfa556ba2050 I brought in the source files but I did not hook them up since some non-trivial build system and Rust source changes were necessary. Make those changes so we can use the new implementation.

candidates.title: ARM & Aarch64: Add ability to disable hardware crypto for testing.
Revert "Document or remove some uses of `unsafe`"
Document or remove some uses of `unsafe`
candidates.body:
Hey @briansmith, I'm happy to have this merged if it's in a state you're comfortable with, but I also know you were hesitant about taking another dependency. I'd be happy to make any changes or chat about the overall approach.

I can also remove the `derive` feature from `zerocopy` if you'd prefer; that's the bulk of the compilation time (zerocopy itself without the derive is a fairly small library). I'm not sure if compilation time is your primary concern, but I know it is for some crate authors.

candidates.title: deps: Move from `winapi` to `windows-sys`
candidates.body:
`winapi` is in maintenance mode and the new blessed way to access Windows APIs are the `windows`
and `windows-sys` crates. I don't think any types of `winapi` were exposed in the public API so
I used `windows-sys` since it has much faster compile times.

candidates.title: Use `cfg!(target_feature)` for static ARM/AARCH64 feature detection.
candidates.body: Our MSRV supports `if` in const expressions. Implement a workaround for buggy detection on older versions of Rust.

chosen_pr.title: Bump dependency requirements to what's been tested.
chosen_pr.body: Older versions may work but we've not been testing those old versions.
